alert.note: Alert for South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued December 31 at 12:41PM PST until January 03 at 5:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...High water levels around bays and estuaries are possible. * WHERE...Shorelines and waterfronts around tidal basins in Coos County, including North Bend, Coos Bay, and the areas and roads adjacent to sloughs and creeks, including Highways 42 and 101. * WHEN...From Monday morning through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...High water may result in lane closure or complete road closure. Low lying property and infrastructure along area tidal basins, including railroads, could become inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High water levels, resulting from King Tides, heavy rainfall, and storm force winds, are expected to surpass thresholds that have caused minor flooding and road/lane closures in the past. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
